name: vscode-jasmine-test-adapter
description: Run your Jasmine tests in the Sidebar of Visual Studio Code
author: Holger Benl <hbenl@evandor.de>

scripts.rebuild: npm run clean && npm run build

jasmineExplorer.cwd.description: The working directory where Jasmine is run (relative to the workspace folder)

jasmineExplorer.config.description: The location of the Jasmine config file (relative to the working directory)

jasmineExplorer.env.description: Environment variables to be set when running the tests

jasmineExplorer.debuggerPort.description: The preferred port to use for debugging sessions

jasmineExplorer.nodePath.description: The path to the node executable to use. By default it will attempt to find it on your PATH, if it can't find it or if this option is set to `null`, it will use the one shipped with VS Code

jasmineExplorer.nodeArgv.description: The arguments to the node executable to use. To enable typescript support, install the ts-node npm package and set this property to ["-r", "ts-node/register"]

jasmineExplorer.jasminePath.description: The path to the jasmine package to use (relative to the workspace folder). By default (or if this option is set to `null`) it uses a bundled version of jasmine, to use the one installed in your project's node_modules folder, set this option to "node_modules/jasmine". This is necessary if you want to use the `requires` property in `jasmine.json` to load packages installed locally in your project's `node_modules` folder.

jasmineExplorer.debuggerConfig.description: The name of a launch configuration to use for debugging sessions

jasmineExplorer.breakOnFirstLine.description: when debugging, inject a breakpoint at the 1st line of the 1st run test

jasmineExplorer.debuggerSkipFiles.description: An array of glob patterns for files to skip when debugging

jasmineExplorer.logpanel.description: write diagnotic logs to an output panel

jasmineExplorer.logfile.description: write diagnostic logs to the given file
